verbose_text: In other rhizobial strains, sugar methylation has been correlated to the switch to an increase in the surface hydrophobicity from a predominantly hydrophilic state.10, 39, 40 It has been also hypothesized that, together with the features of lipid A--the presence of VLCFA and hopanoid moieties--the presence of methylated sugar units can further contribute to increased bacterial envelope stability and barrier properties as well as bacterium adhesion ability, for example, that facilitating plant-microbe interactions.
